definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: This little present is for you as a token of our love. We hope you can use it.
sentences.chinese: 送你这个小礼物，聊表我心意，希望你能用得上。

sentences.english: Yeah. I think it’s applied at home, though.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我认为它在家里用得上。

sentences.english: An administrative abstrusearial position wactuality advice abilities and a affable attitude against humans will be assets.
sentences.chinese: 行政秘书的职务，用得上交际技能和与人为善的立场。

sentences.english: The issue is whether there are any ideas so good today that they will survive into the future.
sentences.chinese: 问题在于今天这么多好点子能不能在将来用得上。

sentences.english: I'll keep your suggestion in mind for the future.
sentences.chinese: 我会记住你的建议，将来也许用得上。

sentences.english: Do you use English in your work?
Then she programs possible moves that I can use if a new situation arises.
sentences.chinese: 然后她把我在新情况下可能用得上的动作也编出程序。

sentences.english: When they're useful, they're very useful.
sentences.chinese: 可以说，当它们用得上的时候，就会非常有用。
